headline: Intel Stock Is Soaring. Analysts Don’t Know Why.
summary: Intel  stock jumped Tuesday, and it’s hard to figure out why.  Citi analyst Christopher Danely raised his price target to $24 from $21, but that was Monday.  “Nothing new or fundamental,” says Mizuho managing director and technology specialist Jordan Klein, adding there has been a rotation into semis, which could give Intel a boost considering its starting point.

raw.headline: Intel Stock Is Soaring. Analysts Don’t Know Why.
raw.summary: Intel  stock jumped Tuesday, and it’s hard to figure out why.  Citi analyst Christopher Danely raised his price target to $24 from $21, but that was Monday.  “Nothing new or fundamental,” says Mizuho managing director and technology specialist Jordan Klein, adding there has been a rotation into semis, which could give Intel a boost considering its starting point.

headline: Mobileye Announces Secondary Offering of Shares of Class A Common Stock, Concurrent Repurchase and Conversion
summary: JERUSALEM, July 08, 2025--Mobileye Global Inc. (Nasdaq: MBLY) ("Mobileye") today announced the commencement of an underwritten secondary public offering of 45 million shares of Mobileye’s Class A common stock by Intel Overseas Funding Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel Corporation (the "Selling Stockholder"). The Selling Stockholder intends to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 6.75 million shares of Mobileye’s Class A common stock.

raw.headline: Mobileye Announces Secondary Offering of Shares of Class A Common Stock, Concurrent Repurchase and Conversion

(Nasdaq: MBLY) ("Mobileye") today announced the commencement of an underwritten secondary public offering of 45 million shares of Mobileye’s Class A common stock by Intel Overseas Funding Corporation, a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel Corporation (the "Selling Stockholder"). The Selling Stockholder intends to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 6.75 million shares of Mobileye’s Class A common stock.

headline: Why Is Intel (INTC) Stock Soaring Today

headline: Why Intel Stock Is Jumping Today
summary: Intel is laying off 500 employees from its Oregon fabrication hub as part of a broader plan to cut 20% of its global workforce.  Shares of Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) are spiking on Tuesday, up 6.4% as of 1:13 p.m. ET.  Intel began laying off employees from one of its operational hubs in Oregon as part of its major cost-cutting efforts.

headline: IBM rolls out new chips and servers, aims for simplified AI
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -International Business Machines on Tuesday announced a new line of data center chips and servers that it says will be more power-efficient than rivals and will simplify the process of rolling out artificial intelligence in business operations.  IBM introduced its new Power11 chips on Tuesday, marking its first major update to its "Power" line of chips since 2020.  These chips have traditionally vied against offerings from Intel and Advanced Micro Devices in data centers, particularly in specialized sectors such as financial services, manufacturing and healthcare.
